Text.Value: Lolth has discarded me, and the cult of the Absolute abused my mind, and stole my body. If you stand against them, you stand with me.
I am loathe to put an ultimatum to you, but either Minthara or I must leave. I shall honour your choice, whatever it may be.
He's right, Minthara. I'm not willing to risk travelling with you.
Agreed. Goodbye, Minthara.
Then you must go, Halsin. I'm sorry.
May the Oak Father preserve you throughout the challenges that await. You shall be in my prayers, always.
It was the Absolute that directed my hand toward your grove - the same Absolute that I am sworn to destroy now that I am free of its influence.
I know that was not easy, but you made the right choice. A viper cannot escape its true nature, no matter how calm it may seem.
Not my problem. You're on your own.
If we meet again, kill me quickly if you can. I prefer oblivion to enslavement.
I am sorry. You have proven an unmatched ally to me... but I cannot remain with you if that killer, Minthara, is to stay also.
Regrettable. But if I am forced to weigh her life and freedom against your own, then I see little choice.
The Absolute was just an excuse to indulge your base instincts. You shall find another.
If that is your wish, so be it. I sincerely hope I am proven wrong, but I cannot remain in order to find out.
Spare me your sanctimony, druid. You kill to preserve your natural order, do you not? Or are the claws and fangs simply for show?
Then I must say farewell.
I am not without sympathy... but the risk is too great. We may share a foe, but we cannot be allies.

EditorData.NodeContext: Ever so slightly wavering, but then finds his resolve,.

Text.Value: If I leave, I die.
I am no stranger to the Underdark. Cruelty comes to Lolth's followers as naturally as breathing. I have seen it - experienced it.
What do you say to that, Halsin?
I can't do that to her, Halsin. She stays with us.
I'm sorry, Minthara, but I trust Halsin's judgment. You need to leave.
I have no quarrel with you.
Minthara is dangerous - and that's precisely what we need to win this fight. She stays, Halsin.
I'm sorry, Minthara, but you need to leave.
Thank you, for all you have done. Thaniel shall never forget you. Nor shall I.
No... worse than death. If I leave, if I am not protected from the Absolute's voice as you are, then it will take me again. Body, mind and soul.
Goodbye.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: She walks away from the group, toward the outskirts of camp

Text.Value: So be it.
She's right - if we force her to leave, we condemn her to a horrible fate.
I am sorry. You took great lengths to help me - to help Thaniel... but I cannot remain with you if that killer, Minthara, is to stay also.
She would have commanded her minions to slaughter everyone in the grove, given the chance. It was only because of Kagha's foolishness that she was denied her bloody prize.

Synopsis: Minthara arrives in your camp for the first time. Halsin confronts her by the camp fire; he refuses to work with Minthara and issues an ultimatum that one or the other of them must leave.
